children: A 49-year-old man is evaluated for cough and recent onset of hemoptysis.
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

The most likely diagnosis is lung cancer. Flattening of the normal angle between the base of the nail and the cuticle, as well as possible swelling of the distal digit, is called clubbing. Although seen in patients with lung cancer, it can also occur in other pulmonary conditions, such as bronchiectasis and tuberculosis, as well as cardiac and gastrointestinal conditions. This patient with clubbing, cough, and hemoptysis most likely has lung cancer.

objective.__html: Diagnose clubbing associated with lung cancer.
